definition[0]: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen
example[1]: I’m afraid I’ll have to cancel our meeting tomorrow.
example[2]: You’ll just have to ring John and cancel.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people often say call something off rather than cancel something:
definition[1]: to end an agreement or arrangement that you have with someone
example[3]: I phoned the hotel to cancel my reservation.
example[4]: The bank agreed to cancel all the company’s debts.
definition[2]: to say officially that a document can no longer be used or no longer has any legal effect
example[5]: I phoned the bank to cancel the cheque.
example[6]: The teacher was ill so classes were cancelled for the day.
example[7]: I was feeling better so I cancelled my doctor’s appointment.
example[8]: They were forced to cancel the concert when the conductor became ill.
definition[3]: to cancel a meeting, game, or event that you have organized. Call off is less formal than cancel and is very commonly used in everyday English
example[9]: Linda decided to call the wedding off.
example[10]: The game was called off due to heavy rain.
definition[4]: if an event or activity is off, it has been cancelled because of a sudden problem or change in someone’s plans
example[11]: I’m afraid the party’s off. Nick won’t let us use his apartment.
example[12]: Myers called me yesterday to tell me that the deal was off.
definition[5]: to decide to do something at a later time, instead of the time that was officially planned
example[13]: The show has been postponed until next Saturday.
definition[6]: to decide not to continue with a plan, project etc although it may be considered again at some time in the future
example[14]: Plans for a new stadium have been shelved for now.
example[15]: The project had to be put on ice due to lack of funding.
example[16]: Blears called for the discussions to be put on ice until after the elections.
definition[7]: to officially decide that a marriage, result, or agreement has no legal authority and is therefore cancelled
example[17]: The election results were annulled by the courts.
example[18]: A marriage can be annulled if there has been lack of consent.
definition[8]: to arrange that a planned activity or event will not now happen
example[19]: Airport security has been increased but there is no intention of cancelling flights.
example[20]: Because of the takeover moves the meeting was cancelled.
example[21]: Some airlines have been forced to cancel orders.
definition[9]: to end an agreement or arrangement that exists in law
example[22]: You can suspend or even cancel your contract for the period you are away.
definition[10]: to draw lines across a document so that it no longer has any legal effect
